definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: So she said, come to the Japanese school in Acton on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 因此她說，星期二去阿克頓的一個日文學校。

sentences.english: Japanese in the library cataloguing is not used frequently.
sentences.chinese: 日文在圖書館編目語種中屬於小語種。

sentences.english: Mr Noguchi writes messages in both English and Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 野口先生用英文和日文寫消息。

sentences.english: But the rollcall of Japanese names went on.
sentences.chinese: 但日文名單仍在繼續被披露。

sentences.english: I haven't marry, and I still a student. I major in Japanese in XX University.
sentences.chinese: 目前未婚還是個學生，就讀於xx大學主修日文。

sentences.english: Sorry I use hiragana. I never study kanji.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉我用平假名，我從沒學過日文漢字。

sentences.english: The problem is that the updated docs have not been translated from Japanese yet.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲最新的文檔還沒有從日文翻譯成英文。

sentences.english: I have a number of columns of poetry that I do in Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 我一些關於詩的專欄，都是用日文寫的。

sentences.english: I think if I practice Japanese more, I will speak Japanese more fluently.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得如果我越練習日文，我將講得更順。

sentences.english: Japanese keyboards do not directly support Kanji characters.
sentences.chinese: 日文鍵盤不直接支持日文漢字字符。

sentences.english: Japanese keyboards do not directly support Kanji characters.
sentences.chinese: 日文鍵盤不直接支持日文漢字字符。

sentences.english: Peter is scared of his Japanese teacher.
sentences.chinese: 彼得懼怕他的日文老師。

sentences.english: It usually takes me about a year after the English version comes out to do the Japanese translation.
sentences.chinese: 通常在英文版問世之後，譯者需要一年翻譯成日文版。

sentences.english: More often than not, dubbing houses also provide English translations of the original Japanese scripts.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，配音項目組也會提供日文劇本的英文譯本。
他除了學英文外，還學日文。

sentences.english: You could not say a word in Japanese, but you followed him and crooned freely, facing the sea breeze.
sentences.chinese: 你不懂半句日文，也跟著老人在海風中亂哼亂唱。

definition: traditional form of Chinese, as opposed to simplified form 簡體|简体[jian3 ti3]
simplified form of Chinese characters, as opposed to traditional form 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3]
simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
Kappa, a child-size humanoid water creature in Japanese folklore
